basic.floral_language:
Penstemon campanulatus
Floriography: beautiful, vigorous, lovely
Penstemon campanulatus is an herb with graceful shape and dark green lanceolate leaves, bell-shaped flowers slightly drooping with bright colors in pink, purple, or blue, etc., loved by the public. Suitable for arranged flower beds or potted plants for home decoration.
Penstemon campanulatus like sunny places, slightly resistant to half shade, shade properly in summer to avoid strong sunlight. Flowering period in May-June for 2-3 weeks.
basic.blooming: Flowering period May-June, viewing period 2-3 weeks

maintenance.soil: Peat or soil with specific nutrients
maintenance.sunlight: Like adequate light, slight resistant to half shade, shade properly under strong light in summer
maintenance.watering: Water thoroughly after soil surface dries
maintenance.fertilization: Dilute fertilizers following instructions, apply twice monthly in spring
maintenance.pruning: Remove withered flowers, old, diseased, and dead leaves timely

search_results: Pride of the Mountain (Penstemon campanulatus var. chihuahuensis)
